data.title: Unveiling Johnny Wright's Hair Styling Journey: From Home to The White House by SUAVV Sessions: The Podcast
data.meta_description:
Johnny Wright started his career in a shop built by his father. After years of work, dedication, and networking, he landed one of the most prestigious clients in the world...Michelle Obama. Taking his career and opportunity to the highest level of excellence, he produced some of the most iconic images of a first lady since Jacqueline Kennedy. 

While his story is a tale of triumph, his future is a novel. The Naturally You Tour and his new book Natural and Curly Hair for Dummies are the next steps on a marathon of empowerment.
data.text:
In this powerful SUAVV Sessions episode, host Rashod and guest Dr. Justin Dodson dive into the complexities of mental health and trauma within black communities, sharing personal experiences and professional insights. We cover:

1. Coping mechanisms for racial trauma and the importance of seeking therapy.

2. The impact of societal pressures and stigmas on black men's mental health.

3. Seeking help and setting boundaries to support mental well-being.

4. Understanding healthy relationships and recognizing toxicity.

5. The effects of vicarious traumatization, particularly in the context of the Black Lives Matter movement and the COVID-19 pandemic.

Jonathan Browne, the CEO and founder of Project Casting, delved into his vision for revolutionizing the entertainment industry. His platform aims to provide opportunities for aspiring actors, models, content creators, and individuals behind the camera, highlighting the importance of diverse voices and stories in the entertainment industry. Through the discussion with host Rashod, Browne emphasized the significance of providing access and democratizing the way people get hired in the film industry, actively working towards offering diverse career paths and creating opportunities for a new generation of entertainers. In this episode, we cover: - The diverse career paths in the entertainment industry - The impact of unions and the Hollywood strike - The development and impact of Levy AI on the film industry - Project Casting's mission to democratize the way people get hired in the film industry - The future of entertainment: streaming platforms, social media, and AI.

Dive into the dynamic world of Brad James with Rashod on this episode of SUAVV Sessions. Witness a candid discussion that spans the thrills of stunt work to the thoughtful preparation for challenging roles, all from the perspective of an actor deeply rooted in his military background and love for the arts. - Brad candidly chats about his enthusiasm for doing his own fight scenes, while also recounting a humorous yet cautionary tale involving breakaway glass and his wife's reaction to the risks of stunt work. - Rashod and Brad delve into the actor's affection for the great outdoors, uncovering how Brad's personal interests enrich his professional life and contribute to his well-rounded persona. - The conversation turns to how Brad and his wife master the art of balancing their busy careers with their personal lives, offering insights into their harmonious approach to marriage and work. - Brad opens up about his early life in Augusta, Georgia, discussing the profound impact his upbringing, military background, and the inspiration from kung fu movies had on his career trajectory. - Discover the meticulous process Brad employs to prepare for roles, including the physical transformations he undergoes and his philosophy around absorbing a character's essence without immersing in the full script.

Join us on this episode of SUAVV Sessions as host Rashod dives into a lively discussion with the multi-talented Mr. 88 about the evolving music scene and his unique artistic journey. Prepare for an insightful conversation filled with personal stories, professional challenges, and visionary goals.

- Discover how Mr. 88 incorporates European sounds into hip-hop and aims to break typical genre boundaries.

- Learn about his new music project, inspired by artists like Kanye West and Pharrell Williams.

- Hear Mr. 88's thoughts on the impact that live instrumentation has on his music, enhancing the depth and authenticity of his sound.

- Explore the challenges and triumphs during his participation in the competitive show "One Shot," and his dynamics with the judges.

- Get insights into his clothing line "dead people," and how he uses fashion to extend his creative expression beyond music

Are you ready for an emotional journey that will resonate with your soul? SUAVV Sessions invites you to an exclusive interview from our What's The Brew series with PsyberTV with the riveting Bernard Owens, a mental health clinician, motivational speaker, and author who's breaking barriers and opening hearts.

In this profound episode of the SUAVV Sessions Podcast, Bernard gets candid with Rashod about the pressing issues men face today. From the complexities of parenting at various life stages to the critical conversations on mental health that too often go unspoken, Bernard delivers raw insights wrapped in wisdom gained from personal struggle and triumph.

üîä Tune in to find out how Bernard:

- Fosters genuine connections and navigates racial microaggressions in the professional world.

- Embraces vulnerability and true friendship as keys to mental well-being.

- Handles the intricacies of family dynamics, loss, and the importance of self-forgiveness.

- And much more...

Whether you've faced heartbreak, loss, or are just yearning for a deeper connection, this episode offers a safe space for recognition and reflection.

In this SUAVV Sessions video, Da Brat and Judy open up about their emotional journey to parenthood, sharing the ups and downs they experienced and the profound gratitude they feel for their new blessing. They discuss their fears and joys throughout the pregnancy, shedding light on the unexpected and beautiful aspects of the process.

Throughout the episode, they delve into the challenges of balancing parenthood with their business endeavors, giving viewers an inside look at how they navigate the responsibilities of raising a child while managing a business empire. Additionally, they touch on the significance of protective hairstyles and share insights into their new haircare collection. Lastly, the duo delves into their strong stance on LGBTQIA representation in hip hop, offering their perspectives on the community's reception and the importance of authenticity.

Social media has been a part of our lives since the break of the millennium. From Black Planet, Myspace, facebook, Model Mayhem, tumblr, instagram, tiktok, snapchat, and more, the daily use of social platforms has stopped being shaped by the user and is now shaping the person in front of the screen.

Some legislators are looking to change that. With laws coming out of Florida, Texas, and other states, alongside of immense pressures from parents, medical professionals, and social activist groups, the landscape of social media may be seeing a purge and the lenience of some laws.

Today, we are going to talk about both of them.

Join SUAVV Sessions as we dive into the compelling story of Brock McGillis, a trailblazer for LGBTQ+ visibility in the world of hockey. Discover the strides and struggles of coming out in a traditionally masculine sport and the work being done to foster inclusivity.

- Brock McGillis challenges homophobic beliefs, highlighting the importance of personal growth and fostering critical thinking in religious and other discriminatory environments.

- Witness Brock's personal journey of coming out in professional sports and the overwhelming support that followed, alongside the realities of negative responses from various backgrounds.

- Learn about Brock's "culture shift tour" initiative aimed at combating homophobia and offering support to marginalized communities within the sports world.

- Explore the generational shifts in attitudes towards the LGBTQ+ community, with Gen Z leading the way in acceptance, yet still facing obstacles from older generations.

- Brock McGillis emphasizes the significance of advocacy beyond LGBTQ+ issues, including combating racism, misogyny, and ableism, and the crucial role of language and action in challenging discrimination.

Hey there! Dive into this heart-to-heart with Rodney Jon on SUAVV Sessions and More, where we unpack the powerful story of how faith and grit sculpted her path from humble beginnings to an Emmy-nod in makeup artistry.

- Get the lowdown on Rodney's wild ride from flipping burgers to starring in the McDonald's commercial spotlight.

- Sit in on the life-changing chit-chat that set Rodney's sights on a major career move back to the Big Apple, all thanks to a tip from a hairstylist friend.

- Tune in for the backstory on Rodney's entrepreneurial leap into the world of hats and skincare, sparked by a close call in Africa.

- Rodney spills the beans on his dream to nurture the next gen of talent with a new school agency and an Instagram live series.

- Join us to hear all about the tough times and the incredible folks who stood by Rodney, proving that a little help from your friends goes a long way in showbiz.

In this episode of "Whats The Brew," host Rashod sits down with entrepreneur Rodney Blackstock to delve into the important topic of mental health from a perspective often underrepresented in discussions ‚Äì that of black men in the professional world. The conversation sheds light on the personal experiences and motivations that led Blackstock to not only establish a successful insurance agency but also to start a mental health agency. Through open dialogue, the interview offers invaluable insights into the ways in which personal experiences can shape professional paths and the significance of creating safe spaces for individuals to seek support.

Rodney Blackstock offers much-needed insights into the symbiotic relationship between personal experiences, entrepreneurship, and mental health advocacy. Blackstock's story encapsulates the transformative power of channeling adversity into purpose-driven endeavors, ultimately paving the way for meaningful contributions to individuals and communities alike. As we navigate conversations surrounding mental health and professional success, Blackstock's narrative serves as a poignant reminder of the resilience and empathy that can fuel genuine change.

In this episode of What's The Brew, Rashod hosts an insightful interview with passionate LGBTQ+ advocates, Obo Jones and Omar. The conversation dives deep into the complex intersectionality of being black and gay, challenging societal expectations, dealing with homophobia, and the mental health journey in the LGBTQ+ community.

Despite the hurdles, the conversation liberates and lends a fresh perspective toward understanding the dynamics of the LGBTQ+ community. It underscores the need for change in societal attitudes, being able to see past discriminatory practices, and promoting acceptance. The intersectionality of being black and gay is complex, but Obo and Omar provide insight into navigating it bravely. This enlightening conversation ties up with an appreciation for the group and gratitude for the platform that aids in spreading awareness. In essence, understanding the struggles and experiences of LGBTQ+ individuals assists in the creation of a community that's truly inclusive and empathetic. After all, love is love, irrespective of orientation and identity.

In a thought-provoking conversation with Dr. Debbie Stevens, a psychiatric nurse practitioner at Restoring Hope Recovery Group in Atlanta, Georgia, we delved into the depths of psychology, focusing on racial trauma and the vital role of finding the right therapist. As Dr. Stevens shared her personal journey into the field of mental health practice, her insights shed light on the nuances of racial trauma and the significance of seeking therapy. This discussion revealed the complexities of trauma, the impact of generational experiences, and the importance of culturally competent care, providing valuable guidance for those navigating their mental health journeys.

Navigating racial trauma and finding the right therapist can be pivotal in fostering mental well-being and healing. Dr. Debbie Stevens' insightful perspectives illuminated the complexities of trauma, the significance of culturally competent care, and the growing awareness surrounding mental health. As the conversation unfolded, it became evident that proactive mental health care, informed by empathy and understanding, is integral to addressing racial trauma and broader mental health challenges. This conversation serves as a guiding light for individuals embarking on their mental health journeys, emphasizing the transformative impact of therapeutic support tailored to their unique experiences.

When Ben Raymond talks about his life, it's a tapestry of triumph over trauma, resilience, and an unwavering belief in the power of transformation. Raised without stability, thrown into foster care, and abandoned by a father he later found in federal prison, Ben's childhood was far from easy. Yet, these experiences fueled his personal and professional growth.

Despite the hurdles, Ben's gratitude for the journey is apparent. His story underscores the transformative potential of confronting the past and harnessing its lessons for the future. Ben's experiences serve as an inspiration for others, demonstrating that adversity can indeed be the catalyst for incredible personal and professional growth.

This series is in partnership with PSYBER TV

AUDIO BY: 4Grounds Media

Our conversation with William Hollis dug into the deep trenches of self-doubt, offering a perspective that proves it's necessary to remove the restricting barriers we construct for ourselves. Hollis, despite his undeniable hardship, inspired us by emphasizing the importance of looking beyond our circumstances and reaffirming the value in ourselves. He encourages us to "stop doubting and not allow things to make you question your abilities‚Äù ‚Äì something that resonates with many who are battling the instinct to play it safe.

One of the truths that Hollis lives by, and which he shared during the discussion, is the importance of seizing opportunities despite personal pain. Having lost both of his parents, he knows very well the anguish that can envelop one's existence. However, through his journey, he has found the strength to harness his suffering and use it as fuel to highlight the significance of choosing the right path in life. Hollis insists that while we may feel committed to the salvaging of others, it‚Äôs our purpose and passion that ultimately bring us closer to our true potential.

The enlightening session with motivational speaker William Hollis emphasized the potency of self-belief, resilience, purpose, and helping others. His story serves as a call to action to find the greatness within ourselves and use it to positively impact our communities.

This series is in partnership with PSYBER TV

AUDIO BY: 4Grounds Media

Todd Tucker has become a familiar face thanks to his recurring presence on Bravo's Real Housewives of Atlanta being the husband of singing superstar Kandi Burruss. However, his career in film production, becoming a restauranteur, and his new career as a film director truly solidified him as a true staple on the show.

Todd Tucker and Kandi Burruss have a new movie out called "The Pass". In this movie, they discuss the real-life issues that could arise when giving your partner a pass to have a sexual partner outside of the marriage. Trust me when I say the plot twist is REAL.

If you're a fan of "The Real Housewives of Atlanta", then this podcast is for you! Todd discusses his upbringing, his journey in production and television, being a father, Mama Joyce, and everything else related to the movie. This is a must-listen for any "Housewives" fan!

An athlete from a young age, Grant Hall was an entertainer for as long as he could remember. Being raised in a family of prominent athletes never really motivated Hall to look into entertainment as a career until he suddenly found himself cherry-picked his freshman year in college during his first theater appreciation class. A moment that felt like extreme fruition and somehow a lifelong unknown dream realized, Hall suddenly found himself taking part in on-campus improv and theater clubs while enrolling into various film acting classes. With a newfound purpose in life, Hall didn't hesitate to sign with his first manager and, soon thereafter, made his move to LA ‚Äì Marking the best move in his career.

Fans of the Black-ish spin-off series Grown-ish can currently recognize Grant from Freeform's hit series' fifth season. After Zoey (Yara Shahidi) graduates from Cal U, the series continues with Junior (Marcus Scribner) as the main character. Learning how to tackle college obstacles for himself, Junior quickly learns how easy it is to fall on someone's bad side as he makes an enemy with Cal U's wealthiest high society, Crest and one of their most prominent members, Kyle, portrayed by Grant. Fans of the sitcom series can watch new episodes air on Freeform Wednesday nights at 10:30/9:30c and stream on Hulu.

Before his small screen debut, Hall cut his teeth on web series like Tough Love and Tough Love: Los Angeles, as well as independent shorts such as 2 Eye Drops from Normal, to name a few. Sticking to his independent film roots, Grant can next be seen as the lead in independent film, Trigger. Set to portray Daniel, the film follows Hall as he comes face to face with his father's murder. Struggling to let go of the close bond they once shared, Daniel is led down a dark road where mayhem soon follows - The film will be streaming on Tubi in 2023. Keeping to the small screen, Hall can next be seen in the upcoming television series Cocaine Sister.

Every now and then, I come across an old interview that makes me smile when I listen to it. After watching A Madea Homecoming, this weekend and laughing at the hilarious Mr. Brown (played by David Mann). I looked through "the crates" and found this interview from 2018. We were able to do this interview while the couple was promoting their book and album project "Us Against the World". As I do from time to time, I had a guest interviewer, a good friend of mine, Tyrese Thomas. Tyrese is the leader of an amazing music group "The Healed Project", and host of the upcoming podcast "Hopester Culture". During this interview we were able to learn a lot about David and Tamela, their friendship, their beginning with Kirk Franklin, how they became Tyler Perry's Power Couple, and their advice on how to keep pushing in the music industry, in life, and in religion.

Detroit is on the rise and so are the people. It‚Äôs a city where Black culture is strong. This reemerging city is all about family, friendship, business, excellence and of course, love and marriage. ‚ÄúLove & Marriage: Detroit‚Äù will center on a group of African American families with deep ties to Detroit who have decided to stay in the city and prove they can provide the best lives possible for their families in this community on a comeback. The series comes to OWN from renowned reality producer and Detroit native Carlos King, CEO of Kingdom Reign Entertainment. The season will introduce a new group of dynamic Black community members and leaders, this time from the ‚ÄúComeback City‚Äù formerly known as the ‚ÄúMotor City.‚Äù The third city to join the Love & Marriage series franchise following Huntsville and Washington D.C., ‚ÄúLove & Marriage: Detroit‚Äù is ready to show up and show out. The couples, Russell and Kolby Harris, Brandon and Kristina Bowman Smith, and Anthony and Dr. LaToya Thompson will star in the series. In the premiere season, secrets and past deeds haunt the couples as relationship cracks are exposed, and issues surrounding faith, resentment, and broken lines of communication are tackled head-on. ‚ÄúLove & Marriage: Detroit‚Äù was created by renowned reality TV producer, Carlos King, and is produced by Kingdom Reign Entertainment with executive producers King, Angela Dugan, Brent Nisbett, and Tarin Laughlin.

Dave Brown would consider himself Hollywood‚Äôs best friend. He understands how to maneuver through Hollywood as a film director, actor, or producer. So he tapped one of his clients, Morris Chestnut, to help him launch the Indy Night Film Festival. In an arena where he gives space for new filmmakers, actors, producers, and directors to enter into the area of making film in a way that they may not have been able to otherwise. This weekly showcase and networking event is a hit in Los Angeles, so now that Covid is behind us, he decided to take the show on the road. This month, they decided to stop in Atlanta, and that‚Äôs where we were able to meet Dave and Morris and find out why this venture was important to them.

The Sounds of Success Community Marching Band ("The SOS Warriors") and its Founder and Band Director Antoine Miller. Antoine is a saxophonist and former public school teacher in Palm Beach County, Florida, who has been playing instruments and performing in marching bands since middle school. Using the knowledge and experience he gained as a former saxophonist in the Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University's (FAMU") Marching 100 marching band, Antoine teaches youth between the ages of 5 and 23 about music and marching band fundamentals.

The SOS Warriors is a multi-award-winning band that competes across the southern United States. The band also performs at FAMU homecoming events and the Florida Classic. Some youth graduate from high school, audition, and perform in marching bands at historically Black colleges and universities. Antoine and other music and dance leaders volunteer their time and talents with the youth to help create a positive path in their lives. In addition to the United States, the SOS Warriors have caught audiences' attention in the United Kingdom. In the summer of 2023, the band will travel to London as the only U.S. community marching band to play during London Band Week. Antoine is fundraising to raise $500,000 so that each band member can perform in London without any financial support from their families.

Candace Maxwell had an interesting start to her acting career. Though it started at an early age, it wasn't something that her mother was too excited about. Nonetheless, after she began working as a paid performer, the dedication and sacrifice clearly paid off. Many of us know Candace as "Dime", the emcee on the hit BET show "All The Queens Men" starring Eva Marcille, Christian Keyes, Skyh Black, Racquel Palmer, and an array of Male Exotic Dancers. However, her first television role was that of the romantic interest of Larenz Tate on STARZ cult-classic series "POWER".

We wanted to know who Candace is in true SUAVV form. Candace Maxwell shares her inspirational story of how she overcame many obstacles and reached her goal of becoming a successful actress. Candace shares her tips on how to overcome any obstacle and reach your goals, and her story will inspire you to reach for the stars no matter what life throws your way.

Growing up as a Black kid, being a superhero was a part of daily imaginary games. However, we never saw them on television or in movies. Well, all of that is changing. We see more Black Superheroes on the big and small screens. The latest addition to the list is Marcus Nelson. While we can't tell you the name of the movie that he is in, we can tell you that it's a DC Comics Film. We talked to Marcus about how he found his "cape" and wore it proudly.

Kel Mitchell has entertained us for years. From his stint on Nickelodeon's All That to Keenan and Kel, and his iconic role as Ed in Good Burger, Kel has not only made us laugh, but allowed us to embrace the sillier, childlike sides of us at a time when most of us were transitioning into adulthood.

Since the late 90's early 2000's, Kel has takend more on a behind-the-scenes role in entertainment, He has done writing, directing, and producing projects, became a youth pastor, and an author. The many hats that Kell now wear, don't define who he is, they empower who he is becoming.

We sat down to talk about how Kel stayed grounded during his upbringing in the entertainment industry, how his religion helped push him into new heights, and his latest project "Prank Day, a children's book that has the potential to do amazing things for him.

Latrice Rogers is one of the cast members of OWN tv's hit show Belle Collectives. This Hair Care Mogul discussed a lot this recent season of the show and even more clarification to those interactions in our podcast. You'll get to hear Latrice's side of the story on her drama with castmate Marie, Discussing a baby with her husband Cliff, talking to her mother about womanhood, and where she wants to take her business in the future. There are a lot of funny moments in this podcast as well as revelations that you more than likely dont know. As always, kick back and relax... This is SUAVV Sessions.
